alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 16 at 7:07AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM HST THIS MORNING FOR THE ISLAND OF HAWAII IN HAWAII COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County. * WHEN...Until 800 AM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 703 AM HST, radar indicated that heavy rainfall has diminished and moved offshore of windward Big Island, though isolated showers are falling at rates of up to an inch an hour. Windward streams remain elevated, and additional periods of heavy rainfall are expected through tonight. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hilo, Hawaiian Paradise Park, Kapaau, Honokaa, Pohakuloa Camp, Honomu, Papaikou, Laupahoehoe, Pepeekeo, Ninole, Hakalau, Ookala, Mountain View, Glenwood, Volcano, Paauilo, Pohakuloa Training Area, Keaau and Hawaiian Acres. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 800 AM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding. A Flood Watch is also in effect through tonight.
